title: The Crown's Josh O'Connor and Emma Corrin film series four
text:
Advertisement

Emma Corrin and Josh O'Connor transformed into Princess Diana and Prince Charles on Thursday as they continued to film scenes for series four of The Crown in Spain.

The pair looked the spitting image of the royals as they recreated the married couple's visit to Sydney Harbour Bridge during their 1983 tour of Australia.

Emma, 23, who is set to make her debut as the late Princess of Wales, wore a red polka dot dress and a matching mesh veil bow hat as she sat next to Josh, 29, in the replica of the iconic Rolls Royce Phantom V.

Royal tour: Emma Corrin and Josh O'Connor (pictured left) transformed into Princess Diana and Prince Charles (pictured right in 1983) on Thursday, as they continued to film scenes for series four of The Crown in Spain

With her blonde hair perfectly coiffed and swept over to the side, the Pennyworth actress emulated Diana's shy body language down to a tee and coyly smiled at Josh during filming.

Josh, meanwhile, sported Charles' signature combed over hairstyle and looked dapper in a dark suit, complete with a navy tie.

Emma was in her element as she traveled across the Spanish set in the Rolls Royce Phantom V replica- which was the vehicle bought by the Australian government in 1967 for royal visits.

Transformation: Emma, 23, who is set to make her debut as the late Princess of Wales, wore a red polka dot dress and matching mesh veil bow hat as she sat next to Josh, 29, in the replica of the iconic Rolls Royce Phantom V

Filming: Emma was in her element as she traveled across the Spanish set in the Rolls Royce Phantom V replica, which was the vehicle bought by the Australian government in 1967 for royal visits

Off they go: The pair looked the spitting image of the royals as they recreated visiting the Sydney Harbour Bridge during their 1983 tour of Australia

People's Princess: With her blonde hair perfectly coiffed and swept over to the side, the Pennyworth actress emulated Diana's shy body language down to a tee, as she coyly smiled at Josh during filming

In character: Emma (left) looked the spitting image of Princess Diana (right) as she sported Diana's choppy hairstyle and a similar outfit to what the royal wore during her visit to the Perth Hockey Stadium

Making history: Prince Charles and Princess Diana's 1983 trip has plenty of material for The Crown. The Princess of Wales allegedly refused to leave Prince William, aged nine months, behind and so paved a way for royal protocol

At one point during filming, the couple appeared to be having some tense words with Josh smoothing down his hair while Emma looked at him intently.

Several police cars flanked the Rolls Royce as it travelled across the replica of Sydney Harbour bridge before the royal greeted hundreds of fans who lined the streets waving flags.

This is the fourth time fans have had a glimpse of Emma in the role of Diana, after her casting was announced earlier in the year.

Iconic: Screen star Emma was finally unveiled as the actress portraying the much-loved princess, after much speculation about who might be taking on the part

Spitting image: Josh sported Charles' signature combed over hairstyle and looked dapper in a dark suit, complete with a navy tie

Portrayal: This is the fourth time fans have had a glimpse of Emma in the role of Diana, after her casting was announced earlier in the year

Prince Charles and Princess Diana's 1983 trip has plenty of material for The Crown. The Princess of Wales allegedly refused to leave Prince William, aged nine months, behind and so paved a way for royal protocol.

Earlier this week, rising star Emma donned a pink polka dot dress, which was almost a carbon copy of the one Diana wore at the time while visiting the Freemantle Hospital, near Perth.

The designers of the dress paid heavy attention to detail, as the garment featured a cinched waist and twisted detailing around the high neckline, similar to Diana's.

The Prince of Wales: Josh (pictured left) bore a strong resemblance to a young Prince Charles (pictured right). The actor will make his debut as the royal in series three of The Crown next month

On tour: The duo have also been pictured filming scenes which appeared to be from Prince Charles and Diana's visit to the Sydney Opera House

It begins: Emma kicked off filming in the European country alongside Prince Charles actor Josh in late September, just over a month ahead of the show's hotly-anticipated series three premiere

At the time of the trip Diana would have been just 22 and it was her first tour with her eldest son William, who would have been nine months old at the time.

The duo have also been pictured filming scenes which appeared to be from Prince Charles and Diana's visit to the Sydney Opera House.

Emma was finally unveiled as the actress portraying the much-loved princess, after much speculation about who might be taking on the part.

Royal protection: Several police cars flanked the Rolls Royce as it travelled across the replica of Sydney Harbour bridge

History: The scenes shot in Spain will mirror the Prince and Princess of Wales, along with William, when they spent 41 days travelling to Alice Springs, Ayers Rock and Bondi Beach

The TV and film star kicked off filming in the European country alongside Prince Charles actor Josh in late September, just over a month ahead of the show's hotly-anticipated series three premiere.

The scenes shot in Spain will mirror the Prince and Princess of Wales, along with William, when they spent 41 days travelling to Alice Springs, Ayers Rock and Bondi Beach.

Prince Charles actor Josh, has been working on the Netflix series already, as his character appears in season three, which drops on the streaming site next month.

Causing a stir: Hundreds of fans lined the streets, waving flags and taking photos as the Rolls Royce drove along the bridge

Josh shot Charles' investiture scene at Caernarfon Castle in November last year, alongside his on-screen parents Olivia Colman (Queen Elizabeth II) and Tobias Menzies (Duke of Edinburgh).

Shortly after it was announced that she would be playing Diana, Emma took to social media, looking slightly overwhelmed with the media attention she has received since her casting was announced earlier this year.

Referencing the spotlight she now finds herself under, Emma shared a snap of her bewildered expression while she stood above various tabloids, opened to the generally positive news of her casting as the tragic Princess.

Captioning the shot, Emma wrote: ‘What a week! Thank you for the love!'

The Crown Season 3 launches globally on Sunday, November 17
